However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.This is Highly Recommend, a column dedicated to what people in the food industry are obsessed with eating, drinking, and buying right now.Back in 2018, a time that can now officially be referred to as “quaint,” I wrote about how much I love my granny cart. Everything I said then is still true today: It makes grocery shopping infinitely easier, because I can buy what I need, not just what I can comfortably carry. You shouldn’t have to be a powerlifter to be able to bring home a case of seltzer and a couple canned tomatoes.But now, a granny cart is even more invaluable. With most of us making grocery runs as infrequently as possible, a couple tote bags will barely get you through the bean aisle. My granny cart fits a serious weekly shop for my family: a few dozen eggs, the several tubs of yogurt we manage to go through, a few packages of meat and tofu, a modest collection of canned goods, plus plenty of produce including bulky bunches of kale. Definitely a frozen pizza. Plus, I don’t have to worry about sterilizing the germy communal handlebar of a grocery store shopping cart.I have this one, but if I were buying one right now, I’d go with a bigger model like this.
